title: Microsoft partners with The Icehouse to offer SMB technology scholarships
text: Microsoft partners with The Icehouse to offer SMB technology scholarships Posted on 10-Sep-2015 20:17.   Computing . Microsoft New Zealand has announced a new agreement with The Icehouse that will give New Zealand small and medium sized businesses (SMBs) the chance to have Icehouse Business Growth Workshops 50 percent funded by Microsoft. Microsoft will fund 30 scholarships between October and November to support business owners to attend, with close to $20,000 in funding available across three different one and two day workshops: Business Fundamentals, Achieving Business Growth and Grow your Financial Skills Workshops. An additional 12 scholarships will be available early in 2016. Heather Gordon, SMB Sales and Marketing Lead for Microsoft New Zealand says the partnership is about investing in local businesses to enable them to build their skills and capability to support business growth. “SMBs are the backbone of our economy and we’re passionate about seeing them – and our customers – succeed which is why we’ve partnered with The Icehouse,” says Ms Gordon. Andrew Hamilton, CEO of The Icehouse says, “These scholarships will enable us to work with more SMBs to help them learn and grow through our workshop offering. We are grateful to Microsoft New Zealand for creating this opportunity and sharing our aspiration for Kiwi SMBs.”Andrew continues: “With SMBs representing over a third of our economy, support from corporates like Microsoft is essential for the growth of our country.”Businesses who wish to be considered for a scholarship need to complete and submit an application form by Friday 2 October. The recipient of each scholarship will be decided by an Icehouse and Microsoft Panel and announced individually.Scholarships are awarded for a specific workshop and cannot be transferred to another workshop unless permission is granted by The Icehouse.
